newsitem.title: NORWAY: PGS books record revenues in Q3.
newsitem.headline: PGS books record revenues in Q3.

text.p: Norwegian seismic and offshore services company Petroleum Geo-Services ASA (PGS) on Thursday booked record revenues in the third quarter of 903.5 million crowns, a rise of 63 percent from the year-ago period.
The figure included 130 million crowns related to the sale of the group's two-dimensional (2-D) multi-client seismic data. Excluding the sale, revenues showed an increase of 39 percent year on year.

"The increase in total revenues for the third quarter versus the third quarter of 1995 was primarily the result of improved vessel productivity and pricing gains, significant increases in 3-D multi-client marine seismic sales and the final sales related to the company's 2-D multi-client marine seismic data," PGS said in a statement.

Operating profits for the quarter jumped 45 percent to 247.8 million crowns versus 171 million crowns, while income before taxes rose to 197.5 million crowns compared with 159.3 million crowns a year ago.
Earnings per share were posted at 5.09 crowns against 4.06 crowns, a rise of 25 percent.
For the first nine months, revenues soared 52 percent to 2.15 billion crowns against 1.42 billion crowns and operating profits rose to 462 million crowns versus 298 million crowns.
The results fell above expectations and PGS stock surged on the Oslo bourse to an intra-day high at 236 crowns. It later fell back to close at 224 crowns, a gain of 11.50 crowns.
